article.headline: Kamala Harris to accept nomination for vice president: DNC live updates
article.body: Follow along with MarketWatch’s live coverage as Sen. Kamala Harris prepares to accept the Democratic Party’s nomination for vice president, and party luminaries including Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama address the Democratic National Convention. It’s the third night of the party’s convention, a mostly virtual affair this year due to the coronavirus pandemic. Speakers including former President Bill Clinton have blasted President Donald Trump and extolled nominee Joe Biden’s character and policies. Republicans including former Ohio Gov. John Kasich have also vouched for Biden, even as some fellow Democrats like Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Sen. Bernie Sanders have vowed to keep pushing progressive proposals. The second-to-last night of the convention kicks off after U.S. stocks finished lower, a day after the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% index scored its first record close in six months. Speeches begin at 9 p.m. Eastern and run to 11 p.m., with California Sen. Harris’ turn in the spotlight at the end of the evening. Read:Are Democrats wavering on oil subsidies? Biden-Harris climate platform remains fluid | Here’s where Joe Biden has moved to the left — and where he hasn’t | Here’s what Kamala Harris means and doesn’t mean for financial markets
